abstract.description:
Simulated dataset TTJets_HadronicMGDecays_8TeV-madgraph with boosted jets and enriched with simulated tracks and tracker hit data for tracking algorithm studies in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data.

See the description of the simulated dataset names in: About CMS simulated dataset names.

These simulated datasets correspond to the collision data collected by the CMS experiment in 2012. They were released in the context of data science sample production.

methodology.description: These data were generated in several steps (see also CMS Monte Carlo production overview):

configuration_files.title: Modified SIM config to force all-jets decays and pT of both of the tops > 400 GeV and to keep simulated tracks FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step0_ttbar.py
Modified configuration file for HLT step to keep tracker recHits FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step1.py
Modified configuration file for RECO step to keep tracker recHits FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step2.py

pileup.description: To make these simulated data comparable with the collision data, pile-up events are added to the simulated event in this step.

relations.description: This ttbar dataset has boosted jet production enhanced in the generation step, and simulated tracks and reconstructed tracker hits included, and it is a modified version of:

title: Trakcer-hit-enriched TTJets_HadronicMGDecays_8TeV-madgraph FIXME: is it useful to have one word title?
title_additional: Simulated dataset TTJets_HadronicMGDecays_8TeV-madgraph enriched with tracker hits in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data

usage.description: You can access these data through the CMS Virtual Machine. See the instructions for setting up the Virtual Machine and getting started in

links.description: How to install the CMS Virtual Machine
Getting started with CMS open data

validation.description: The generation and simulation of simulated Monte Carlo data has been validated through general CMS validation procedures.

abstract.description:
Simulated dataset for the 300 to 600 bin of QCD_Pt-15to3000_TuneZ2star_Flat_8TeV_pythia6 enriched with simulated tracks and tracker hit data for tracking algorithm studies in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data.

See the description of the simulated dataset names in: About CMS simulated dataset names.

These simulated datasets correspond to the collision data collected by the CMS experiment in 2012. They were released in the context of data science sample production.

methodology.description: These data were generated in several steps (see also CMS Monte Carlo production overview):

configuration_files.title: Modified SIM config to keep simulated tracks FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step0_QCD300to600.py
Modified configuration file for HLT step to keep tracker recHits FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step1.py
Modified configuration file for RECO step to keep tracker recHits FIXME from https://github.com/cms-legacydata-analyses/TrackerRecHitProducerTool/blob/master/configs/step2.py

pileup.description: To make these simulated data comparable with the collision data, pile-up events are added to the simulated event in this step.

relations.description: This QCD dataset contains pTHat bin 300-600 GeV, and has simulated tracks and reconstructed tracker hits included, and it is a modified version of:

title: Trakcer-hit-enriched 300 to 600 bin of QCD_Pt-15to3000_TuneZ2star_Flat_8TeV_pythia6
title_additional: Simulated dataset for the 300 to 600 bin of QCD_Pt-15to3000_TuneZ2star_Flat_8TeV_pythia6 enriched with tracker hits in AODSIM format for 2012 collision data

usage.description: You can access these data through the CMS Virtual Machine. See the instructions for setting up the Virtual Machine and getting started in

links.description: How to install the CMS Virtual Machine
Getting started with CMS open data

validation.description: The generation and simulation of simulated Monte Carlo data has been validated through general CMS validation procedures.
